intro: Commersonia cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf commersonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Commersonia cinerea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
